bibl.title: In and out of the Rut: Callimachus fr. 1.25-28 and Anniceris of Cyrene.
bibl.note: There is a possible reference in the phrase ‡xnia mØ kay' ımã | d€fron §l]çn which commentators have not adduced: both the author of the Lucianic Encomium on Demosthenes [c. 23] and Aelian [Varia historia 2.27] relate an anecdote concerning the virtuoso skills in driving which Anniceris of Cyrene (perhaps one of Callimachus' ancestors) ostentatiously displayed. <ichnia me kath' homa diphron elan>
WILLIAMS Frederick, In and out of the Rut: Callimachus fr. 1.25-28 and Anniceris of Cyrene.
